other_tests.findings: The liver is echogenic, compatible with fatty infiltration. No focal hepatic lesion is seen. The gallbladder is distended and there is wall thickening measuring up to 12 mm and mural edema. Numerous calcified gallstones are present and there is a small amount of pericholecystic fluid. The common bile duct measures 3 mm and there is no intra or extrahepatic bile duct dilatation. The visualized portion of the pancreas is unremarkable. No ascites is present.
